name: Hotel Oceana Santa Barbara

reviews.text: My husband, 4-month-old baby, and I stayed here in April 2005. As I looked for places to stay on an upcoming SB trip, I was reminded of our last trip when we stayed at the Oceana and wanted to write a review.
reviews.title: Average, with nice decoration

likes.disliked: — skimping on upgrading basic elements of the room (i.e., paint, windows, bathroom)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Hot and stuffy

likes.disliked: — HOT and stuffy motel rooms- too expensive

reviews.text: *The new interior decorating that was done in yellows, reds, etc. gave the rooms a very cheery and current feel. I liked the decoration and chose this hotel from the pics online because it didn't look dated, but rather more hip than the other choices in SB. When we arrived, the room was nicely decorated, but it still felt like a motel. It seemed like the property added very superficial touches, but hadn't upgraded the bare bones of the facility. By this, I mean that the bathroom counter tops still felt like an old motel, the windows were old, the room had been painted, but it looked like a homemade job. You could tell the walls had already been painted several times before as the texture was gone and the paint drips lingered at the bottom of the wall.
reviews.title: Friendly and willing staff in a basic clean "motor-lodge"

reviews.text: *The first room we were given was upstairs over the carport looking out at the pool. The room was really small and cramped, so we asked to be moved. The customer service there was great and we were immediately taken to a bottom floor room that opened up to the pool patio. This room had more floor space inside and a small patio with two chairs and a little table and a gate to the pool. The next day we asked to see other rooms on the property so we'd know for future reference, and they were all about the same, just seemed like a lot of variety in size.
reviews.title: An Overpriced Hotel with a Rude Manager

likes.liked: — the location near the beach and State Street
likes.disliked: — the service - the manager was horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *The workout room was small but clean and had nice machines in it. It had a water bottle machine too. It looked out at the beach,which was nice. The massage room is located in the same small building as the workout room. Not sure how that would bode for a relaxing massage with the TV's blaring while others workout. I didn't get a massage, so I don't know.
reviews.title: What a disapiontment and waste of money!
Hugely overpriced - Staff couldn't care less
reviews.text: Maybe A/C is not required in this particular ocean resort - however at more than $350/night when the temperature rises into the 90's and stays that way ALL NIGHT, forget about sleeping. And forget about getting any sympathy from the staff. Cooling fans ???? They've run out and you're on your own. After all, if you can afford $350/night, you can afford to go buy yourself a fan. Safety deposit boxes ???? They run out of those as well.
I'd sooner sleep in my car than EVER return to this place - what a JOKE !!!!
reviews.title: Oceana a delight!

likes.liked: — location, charm, ambience, outdoor landscape, decor
likes.disliked: — decor in lobby needed some mirrors or larger paintings--starket than it needed to be

reviews.text: visiting from Ridgefield, Connecticut
reviews.title: We were SO pleasantly surprised!!

likes.liked: — location, the room we got, the view we had, the staff
likes.disliked: — no air conditioner, a bit noisy

reviews.title: Charming Vacation Hotel
reviews.text: The Oceana delighted me with its tranquility, location, charm and decor. The landscape--green lawn, fountain, tile and abundance of colorful flowers--was fetching. The hotel faces the Ocean and is an easy two-block walk from State Street complete with three Starbucks and other coffee cafes, boutiques, bookstores, movie house, diverse restaurants and an art museum.

reviews.title: Big Disappointment
reviews.text: I teach interior design and especially appreciated the Kathy Ireland designed rooms which had a home-like quality with the toile, checks and non-hotel type fabric and furniture. I felt like I was staying in a charming guest room of a home, not in a hotel.
We stayed for one night on our way down Route 1 from Monterey to San Diego.
reviews.title: Great location, highly recommended

reviews.text: Great location right on the beach, in nice area.
reviews.title: disppointing

reviews.text: Rooms comfortable and clean albeit not that large.
reviews.title: Welcoming Beach Front Hotel in Santa Barbara

reviews.text: Nice clean swimming pool and Gym.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in a fabulous town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good Continental Breakfast included in room price, but gets busy.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Location
Shockingly Bad Experience; Rude, Dishonest Management
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel last September. We arrived at the hotel late and were told that because UCSB was having a parent's weekend, the hotel was overbooked and all that was left was a tiny "single" room. We had no choice but to stay in this room, which contained no closet and was barely bigger than the bed itself. Worse, there was an overwhelming animal odor in the room. When we called to complain, we were told that someone could be sent to spray Febreeze (Thanks a lot!!!). The room was so ridiculously small we complained the next morning. We were told to call the manager during the week. When I called back, I was reassured we would receive a complimentary room on our next visit and that the reservation would be "in the system" under my name. I have just called back a year later, and have been told (after calling back repeatedly for 4 days and getting no calls back) that there is no record of the complimentary room, and the hotel is unwilling to do anything other than offer me a discount. The manager, "Able" was rude and offensive and didn't bother to offer an apology for not hearing from his hotel until I called back for the tenth time. When I spoke to the other manager, "Paula", she *graciously* offered to recommend another hotel in Santa Barbara. This hotel's customer service is unbelievably bad. I would NOT recommend a stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Oceana for our anniversary, and despite the rather high room rate, we were pleasantly surprised. The location is excellent, directly across from the marina, and a short walk to shops downtown and the pier. Upon arrival, attendants at the front desk was very courteous and helpful. There was a bottle of cold champagne in our room with a congratulations letter! Nice touch. The room was in the best location in the entire hotel. Room 231 had two balconies and a sitting area just outside the door. There is no better view of Santa Barbara Harbor than from this room, but it basically hangs over the street. If you'd prefer a more quiet morning, ask for a room in the back. We didn't mind the noise which started early as the city wakes up. Sambo's next door had an incredible breakfast, though the continental free breakfast in the hotel was well attended by guests. Parking was $9 per night... fair, but a little high considering there was no valet. Room taxes were 10.3%. The bathroom could use a few minor maintenance upgrades. We'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Oceana for 3 nights. Three days before our arrival we decided to arrive one day before in SB and threrefore asked for a free room for one additional night. We made a reservation by phone. When arriving, the front desk staff did not find any reservation for the additional first day. Their reservation system seems to be old fashioned and simply not working. They organised a very expensive room for us at the Hilton hotel so we had to spend USD 100 more (it was labour day!!!).
reviews.title: Nice room - incapable front desk staff
no bang for your buck
reviews.text: First we thought that the staff on the phone had made a mistake, but arriving at home we found the reservation confirmation in our email Inbox (I did not have access to my office Email during our vacation). Incredible! They told us: "If you did not get a confirmation number (unfortunately we did not ask for that!) it is not possible that you made a reservation...."

reviews.title: Beware of "Standard Rooms"
reviews.text: In addition, they tried to bill the same expensive rate for all three nights we spend at the hotel. Our email confirmation stated much cheaper rates for the two days after labour day weekend. Unfortunately we had handed in our email confirmation printout when finally checking in (never do that!) on which the rates where stated. It took us discussions of 20 minutes, again they were not able to look up the prices they had confirmed via Email in their system. In addition, the front desk staff was very unfriendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a small room, but very comfortable at the Hotel Oceana. The room rate was very reasonable ($159) as it is one of the last rooms rented. It is up a flight of stairs...and yes there is NO air conditioning, but who needs it with the gentle ocean winds? The rooms are close together, but not unusual for an urban setting. We had a lovely breakfast and the free 2 hours of biking was perfect!! We would recommend.
reviews.title: Perfect for us.....

reviews.text: I booked a king room with partial view and fireplace a few days before my trip and was very satisfied with all aspects of the hotel. The room had been recently renovated and was bright, cheerful and comfortable. It was on the second floor overlooking the pool and was a little noisy but after 10 pm it was very quiet and great for sleeping. Although there was no air conditioning, the ceiling fan kept things comfortable.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel right across the street from the harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I arrived at 4:30 pm I had to wait 10 minutes for my room to be ready, but the staff was super polite and helpful. The location near the harbor and the pier was great - State Street was very close by and the shopping areas are within walking distance. I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: This hotel exceeded my expectations.

reviews.text: I booked the hotel online without visiting and was concerned that the boutique hotel would be old and not as good as the website portrayed. We loved the location. The staff was very helpful with dinner reservations, setting us up with free bicycles at the hotel and helping us with a sudden business issue with use of their business center.
reviews.title: Good location shocking rooms and no service

reviews.text: We would go back in a heartbeat. The only thing that we would do would be to ask for a room with a balcony. We did use the courtyard to relax and read but a balcony would have been great.
reviews.title: Charming and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a couple of nights. Good location and pool area nice. Check-in a bit slow and room off the main complex but clean and tidy. No complimentary tea and coffee so a bit of a rip off. Would go back though mainly for location.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: This was the only disappointment of our trip to California. The location is excellent, but the room while stylish was very basic and the bathroom needs a refurb. You even had to pay for coffee in the room! The continental breakfast was served in a room that was too small for the hotel and was very uninspiring -the kind of offering I'd expect from a budget hotel. This was one of four hotels we stayed in during our Californian trip and although it was the most exensive it was by far the worst!
reviews.title: very disappointing

reviews.text: I was given a chance to visit Santa Barbara for free. Friends got an extra room and I got a room above the pool w/a view of the ocean....
reviews.title: Poolside Room, upper level, balcony view of ocean & pier $300-$400 depending on occupancy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large-expansive complex in the Mission Style....HUGE center lawn with looming Palm trees, 2 pools, gardens......really nice on the eyes.....
reviews.title: nice hotel, but ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, but dated a bit. Colors were green & orange & purple.....go figure???? ......Sort of a "beachy-feel" I'm guessing, but for $300-400 I suggest classing it up just a bit to make people think they're getting MORE bang for their bucks.
reviews.title: friendly, beach style, easy going
Oceana - mixed bag
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Oceana during our California trip (SF to LA) in September (sorry for the late review - had to work to catch up after vacation). Oceana was a mixed bag. The room was very large and nicely decorated (beachy; new); the view was of the ocean, however, the beach at this part of the city is not beautiful - it's prettier in other places). It did feel more like a motel on the outside (the room is nicer, though). It also felt more like a motel as far as service is concerned. We had returned to our room late in the evening after having had a great dinner in a fabulous Peruvian restaurant on State Street. I was thirsty and would have liked to have some water to drink, but the room, although the mini-bar was stocked with everything else in the Universe, did not have any water. I called the front desk. Their reply was that there should have been some water. When I told them that there wasn't, they didn't offer to get me any, and after asking if there was any bottled water anywhere on the premises, they said no. I had to walk to another hotel iseveral blocks away in the middle of the night to get some bottled water out of their vending machine. Very frustrating. Water is so basic. The "kids" at the front desk seemed like high school students with a part time job. Not very professional. The breakfast buffet was was o.k. but not great. Stick with the bagels. The best part was definitely the room - but that's the most important part. Santa Barbara is beautiful. Go check out the courthouse -- great building not to be missed -- seriously.

My family and I stayed here for spring break. my daughter was going 2 visit a few colleges, (UCSB, SBCC and others in CA). we only stayed for two nights but it was a nice little place. we had a room on the first floor, i recomend you to get one on the second floor so you can see the ocean. The pool was very nice. It was out on the open sun, and since Santa Barbara is not that hot in the spring it was a nice place to lay out and get a tan. We also stayed at another hotel down the street from this one, it was terrible, and was not close to anything. we all missed being at Hotel Oceana beacuse it was in walking distance to the beach, the marina, SBCC, state street, and some resturants. The room were a little out dated but the fire place was a cute touch.
reviews.title: so cute!

likes.disliked: — the room we had was on the frist floor

reviews.text: I wanted a quick getaway for my daughter and I to relax and spend time together. We booked th "AHH package" @ the Santa Barbara Oceana Hotel. The package included 2 nights, 2 massages, 2 bottles of wine and free parking, along w/ a great location where we could walk to great attractions. The price for the package was super, considering what we rec'd. The rooms are a little "dated" but charming. Try to get a room w/ 2 beds, as they are bigger than the rooms w/ 1 bed. The fans in the bathrooms are VERY loud, as yoiu can hear your neighbors in the morning when you want to sleep-beware! Our room was to have a Clock radio and CD player, but didn't. When I checked out and mentioned it the receptionist was casual about it and acted like it was no big deal, which I guess it wasn't. The carpet was spotted and the headboard was a little dirty, so if that type of thing bothers you, check your room out first and then agree to take it. All in all, I do that AHH package again.
reviews.title: Consider the Oceana

likes.disliked: — loud fans in bathrooms-could hear neighbors

reviews.text: Well this was my second and hopefully last time at the Oceana. I reserved a full ocean view which was a joke. There was really no view from the room, the only view is through the window facing the very busy walkway. No privacy if you want to see the water across the hwy from your room. It felt very claustrophobic in that ocean view room with no real view. No balconies or patios here either!
reviews.title: What a dump!
Best Location in Santa Barbara Cheap and Cheerful
reviews.text: The room SMELLED awful and was tiny. The rug was stained and the room itself was pretty far from the pool. The breakfast was OK, lots of fruit, breads and coffee!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a long weekend spent at Hotel Oceana on our first trip to Santa Barbara. I booked this based on internet photos and reviews, hoping that the negative ones were isolated incidents. We were more than pleased with the facility. From the warm decor to the comfy bedding, the room was excellent. The bath is quaint with character, small shower, pedestal sink, etc, but very clean. The breakfast bistro is crowded toward the end of serving time, but you can always get yours to go. The complimentary foods included coffee, teas, juice, pastries, boiled eggs, multiple types of breads, yogurt, and fruit. On weekends, they offered a custom omelette for $5, chargeable to your room. If you choose not to eat in the bistro, you can make coffee in your room with a Keurig provided (hence the charge of $2 as others mention). Perfect walking distance to the wharf, restaurant, and shopping. We were in an Ocean view King w/sofabed, which gave us an additional small room, so our room felt like a suite. We will definitely be back!!
reviews.title: Wonderful boutique hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel on July 4th so I can forgive them for not having parking available as they were full. However the front desk guy had a bad attitude from the start, he seemed as if he was doing us a favour by checking us in and didn't give any help on where we could park. He was also answering the phone while talking to us, which I found very rude indeed. Then as he was so distracted by answering the phone, he told us that we had room 101 and when we walked in we were confronted by other guests who were gobsmacked that we had just walked into their room. When we went back to sort it out we got told that he'd made a mistake that we should have 103, along with a half hearted apology that was interrupted again by him answering the phone. The room was pretty basic, no AC which was awful only a squeaky ceiling fan. The sink was blocked which they sorted out pretty quickly. The room was right on an alley that people walked down day and night so it was hard to sleep as you had to have the window open because there was no AC. I thought it was overpriced because for $240 per night you expect AC at least. To top it all off they tried to charge us $10 for parking on the first night when we had to walk 9 blocks back from the place we finally found to park. This place would be good value at around $100 per night with free parking. I won't be staying there again.
reviews.title: Very bad attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our travel adviser had suggested the Hotel Oceana as it was well-situated close to the beach. We had just stayed in a beautiful hotel in Carmel and were expecting something similar in Santa Barbara; this was not the case. We did have a room away from the main hotel section but it was bare and austere, somewhat reminiscent of a run of the mill motel in anytown USA. If you wanted coffee in your room, you had to pay; no complimentary coffee here. We were originally going to stay two nights, but decided to head out to LA a day earlier and, in fact, then secured wonderful accommodations there.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 2nd or 3rd stay here at this hotel. I love the simplicity of the Hotel Oceana. There's no carpeting in the rooms, so no perfume smell built in. You can borrow bikes from the front desk (for free) when you ask. It's charming & not snobby. Breakfast is included, but nothing to rave about - for $5 they will make you a decent omelette. The location is perfect. This last trip we had a King Ocean view room & it was the best trip yet! Yes, it can be a little loud as it's a great location along the main boulevard. I suggest ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. The front desk staff was incredibly polite & helpful whenever we had a question. They had great suggestions for lunch & dinner (try Emilio's, a 2 min walk). We didn't have a car & walked everywhere in SB! Another alternative is to take the 25 cent trolly that'll take you downtown or along the waterfront. We will be back next time we make it down.
reviews.title: Our favorite SB Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Santa Barbara is small but location on the beach front is perfect. Staff were friendly and helpful. No safes in the rooms but boxes available via reception (which is a bit of a pain). 2 hours free bike hire per day. Breakfast room is a bit small. It was busy when were were there and they seemed short staffed. Breakfast room staff were very helpful though and can not be faulted. The hotel was the most expensive of 3 we stayed in whilst in the US. 2 pools to choose from. Parking was only 10 $ per night
reviews.title: really nice hotel, I would recommend

description: We invite you to experience the charming landscape of our Santa Barbara beachfront hotel with endless ocean, mountain, and marina views. Come and enjoy our restful outside courtyard seating areas and scenic second story couches; or spend time in our two outdoor heated pools, Jacuzzi, cabanas or 24-hour ocean front fitness center and breakfast bistro. We are conveniently located just minutes away from the Marina and Stearns Wharf allowing you to access the views that bring everyone to vacation in Santa Barbara. Shopping on State Street is just a 10-minute walk away, and getting here is even easier, as we are located only 20 minutes from the Santa Barbara Airport, and just minutes from the Amtrak station. Our Cabrillo Boulevard address truly cannot be matched when it comes to enjoying all of the lovely natural amenities and adventures that the Santa Barbara beachfront has to offer.
